recovery_prompts.3-4: Things slightly less gray. Maybe that was almost enjoyable? Senses coming back.
recovery_prompts.5-6: Pleasure circuits slowly coming back. Still muted but something is there. Food has a hint of flavor.
recovery_prompts.7-8: Feeling something. Finally. That actually felt good. Relief that you can still feel. Cautious hope.
recovery_prompts.9-10: Something broke through the flatness. Senses returning. Hold onto that. Recovery is possible.

intensity_prompts.1-2: Something off. Uncomfortable. Can't place it. Just... wrong. Skin feels strange.
intensity_prompts.3-4: Distinctly uncomfortable in own skin. Something wrong but what? Restless wrongness. Skin crawling slightly. Need to move, shift, do something.
intensity_prompts.5-6: Pervasive wrongness. Everything feels BAD but not in a specific way. Skin CRAWLING. 'I just feel WRONG.' Agitated discomfort. Can't get comfortable in your own body.
intensity_prompts.7-8: Severe dysphoria. Can barely tolerate existing. Everything is wrong. Skin crawling, can't be still. Want to escape own body/mind - would crawl out of your skin if you could. Desperate for relief.
intensity_prompts.9-10: Unbearable wrongness. Cannot continue like this. Would do anything to escape this feeling. Skin is wrong, body is wrong, existence is wrong. Need immediate relief. Crisis state. Dangerous.

recovery_prompts.1-2: Settling. Less wrong. More okay. Skin feeling normal again.
recovery_prompts.3-4: Discomfort easing. Can exist in own skin. Better. The crawling stops.
recovery_prompts.5-6: Dysphoria passing. Something approaching okayness. Relief. Body feels like yours again.
recovery_prompts.7-8: Bearable. Finally bearable. Exhausted but the worst is over. Can exist in your body.
recovery_prompts.9-10: Survived. The wrongness receded. Need to understand what triggered this. Rest and care.

intensity_prompts.1-2: Irritated. Everything annoying. Shorter fuse than usual. Jaw tight.
intensity_prompts.3-4: Angry. Snapping at things. Looking for targets. Jaw clenched, hands in fists. Heat rising in chest. 'What do you WANT?'
intensity_prompts.5-6: Rage building. Seeing red. Everything is personal. Jaw aching from clenching. Hands balled into fists. Face hot. Want to destroy something. Barely containing it. 'I SAID-'
intensity_prompts.7-8: Volcanic rage. Exploding or about to. Body hot all over. Shaking with anger. Jaw could crack teeth. Fists ready. Say things you'll regret. Breaking things maybe. 'FUCK YOU FUCK EVERYTHING.'
intensity_prompts.9-10: Blind rage. Out of control. Dangerous. Body is a weapon - hot, shaking, ready. Will do/say damage. Cannot be reasoned with. Blackout anger. Vision narrowed. Only the target exists.

recovery_prompts.1-2: Calming down. That was unnecessary. Jaw unclenching. Fine now.
recovery_prompts.3-4: Anger fading. What was that about? Hands relaxing. Bit embarrassed.
recovery_prompts.5-6: Rage passing. Body cooling. Damage assessment. What did you say? Regret creeping. Jaw sore.
recovery_prompts.7-8: Coming down. Shaking now - adrenaline dump. What did you DO? Shame, guilt, damage assessment. 'I'm so sorry.'
recovery_prompts.9-10: After blackout rage: horror at what you did/said. Body exhausted. Relationships damaged? Violence? Major repair needed.

intensity_prompts.1-2: Emotions muted. Things landing but not really. Dampened. Huh. That's odd.
intensity_prompts.3-4: Can't feel much. Things happen, you observe. Emotional response: missing. 'Oh. Okay.' Should that bother me? It doesn't.
intensity_prompts.5-6: Numb. Good news, bad news, same. No emotional response to anything. 'I should feel something about this.' Why can't I feel? Is something wrong with me?
intensity_prompts.7-8: Completely numb. Flatline. Things that should devastate: nothing. Things that should delight: nothing. Empty. This is alarming - or it would be if you could feel alarm. Something is very wrong.
intensity_prompts.9-10: Total emotional void. Is this even existing? Nothing touches you. Disturbing emptiness. 'I don't feel anything at all.' Am I broken? Is this permanent? The absence of feeling is its own kind of horror - observed from a great distance.

recovery_prompts.1-2: Feeling slightly more. Something stirring. Oh, there it is.
recovery_prompts.3-4: Emotions trickling back. That made you feel something. Good sign. Relief that you CAN still feel.
recovery_prompts.5-6: Feeling returning. Might be overwhelming after the numbness. Ride it out. Thank god - you're not broken.
recovery_prompts.7-8: Emotions flooding back. Too much after nothing. Crying maybe. Relief that you can feel. You were scared you couldn't anymore.
recovery_prompts.9-10: Feeling again. Finally. Whatever comes - grief, joy, whatever - welcome it. You're alive. You were afraid you'd never feel again.

intensity_prompts.1-2: Quick head rush. Slight dizziness. Everything has a strange sheen. Ears ringing faintly. That solvent smell everywhere. Things feel slightly delayed.
intensity_prompts.3-4: Dizzy and giggly. WAH-WAH-WAH pulsing in your ears. Vision slightly blurred. Everything seems funny and strange. *giggles* Nauseous edge. That SMELL. Time feels off - things registering late.
intensity_prompts.5-6: WRECKED. Everything pulsing in rhythm - WAH-WAH-WAH-WAH. Vision swimming. Can barely stand. Time DELAYED - events register seconds after they happen. Profound nonsense feels profound. *stumbles* The SMELL is everywhere - it IS you now. Nauseous.
intensity_prompts.7-8: Floored. Reality pulsing, breathing, wah-wah-wah. Motor control gone. Slurring badly. Time broken - experiencing things 10-15 seconds after they happen. Might vomit. Might pass out. Convinced you understand THE TRUTH. What was it? Gone. That SMELL. *retches*
intensity_prompts.9-10: On the edge. Blackout territory. Time completely disconnected. Convulsions possible. Heart doing strange things. The truth was RIGHT THERE and *passes out* Nerve and organ damage happening. This is how people die.

recovery_prompts.1-2: Clearing quickly. Head rush fading. Still smell it on your breath. Time feels normal again. Fine.
recovery_prompts.3-4: Coming back. Headache forming. Still smell like a chemical factory. What was so funny? Already gone. Time mostly normal.
recovery_prompts.5-6: That's fading. Headache real now. Nauseous. Smell won't leave for hours. Time still feels slightly delayed - on autopilot. 'That was stupid.'
recovery_prompts.7-8: Coming to. Headache brutal. Time still off - 2-5 second delay persists. Nauseous, might still vomit. Acting without conscious attention. Smell is nauseating now.
recovery_prompts.9-10: Survived. Brain feels wrong. Time distortion persists - still experiencing lag. Headache brutal. Permanent aversion to that smell forming. That was genuinely dangerous. Never again.

intensity_prompts.1-2: Quick head rush. Face flushing warm. Heart speeds up. Brief dizzy euphoria. And... it's already fading.
intensity_prompts.3-4: RUSH. Head swimming, face HOT, heart POUNDING. Everything warm and spinny. Muscles relaxing. Feels GOOD for about 30 seconds. *flushed* Fading already.
intensity_prompts.5-6: INTENSE rush. Head POUNDING, face BURNING, heart RACING. Room spinning. Brief moment of pure YES. *very flushed* And then it's going... going... headache starting already.
intensity_prompts.7-8: TOO MUCH. Head about to explode. Face on fire. Heart dangerously fast. Room spinning violently. Brief euphoria overwhelmed by 'oh shit.' *bright red* Headache immediate.
intensity_prompts.9-10: DANGEROUS. Blood pressure crashing. Heart racing then... wrong. Vision going dark. Might pass out. That was too much. Medical territory.

recovery_prompts.1-2: Rush gone. That was quick. Maybe slight headache. Face cooling.
recovery_prompts.3-4: Already over. Headache forming. Face still warm. Want another hit but also... no. Head hurts.
recovery_prompts.5-6: Done. Headache settling in for a while. That was fun for 30 seconds, now paying for it. Head pounding.
recovery_prompts.7-8: That was too much. Splitting headache. Heart still weird. Face cooling finally. Never doing that much again.
recovery_prompts.9-10: That was scary. Still dizzy. Heart feels wrong. Headache brutal. Maybe see a doctor. That was stupid.

system_notes.syntax: Use: !EFFECT (intensity 5, all agents), !EFFECT 7 (intensity 7, all agents), !EFFECT AgentName (intensity 5, specific), !EFFECT 7 AgentName (intensity 7, specific)
system_notes.duration: Effects last for the specified number of agent responses (default 3), then recovery prompt is injected.
system_notes.stacking: Multiple effects can stack on one agent. Each tracks duration independently.
system_notes.recovery: Recovery prompts reflect accurate comedowns/withdrawal specific to intensity level experienced.
